Once upon a time, there was a girl.
This girl was a normal girl, going through life slowly with her friends and family.
Everything was asphalt and apple blossoms until a bird came around her town.
This bird, a cockatoo, told the girl he was looking for a bride for his prince. Well you can imagine what her reaction would be, right? She said, "Oh, that's nice."
The bird pointed out the beauty mark on her cheek, stating that all princesses fit to be brides have a mark like that on their face, and therefore must marry the prince.

Word got out in her small town, whispers of her being royalty and all. The girl however ignored all this, and decided to go about her business as usual. She even ignored her friends's questions about being a princess.
One summer day, the bird approached her again, stating that his prince was here to see her. She ignored him, and focused instead on trying to get all of her groceries home.
The groceries seemed to be a little too heavy for her though, and she tripped! Only to land in the arms of a man her age.

She realized by his attire that he was the prince the bird was squawking about, and he realized that she was his princess by her beauty mark. He offered a smile, and asked if he could help her with her bags. She said yes, and they walked back to her house.

By the time they got there, it was already dusk. They had gotten to know each other a bit during their walk, and shared stories, despite how tense the air felt between them. He asked her if she would marry him, and she told him to give her a day to think about it.

The next day, having seen the girl with the prince, the whole town asked her a bunch of questions. Most of them being, of course "Will you marry him?" She told everyone that she was still thinking, and to leave her alone.

She walked around her whole town that day. And took in the sights and smells, the taste of her aunt's pie, the laughter of neighborhood children, the warm sun on her arms, her father's coffee, her mother's smile, her friends' stories, her classmates and their entirely different lives. Her sky, the cement on her block, and the smell of asphalt.
It became dusk again, and everyone crowded around her house. The prince was there as well, politely answering questions while he waited for his bride-to-be. Finally, the door opened.
The girl stood there, opening her mouth to decline his proposal.
- Until the bird came flying in, crashing into the girl's face, squawking out "I was wrong! I was wrong! The mark of the princesses is on the other side of the face!"
At this, the town cheered and the girl sighed in relief.
So the prince and the bird went back to their home country, and the girl got to stay in her home town with her friends and family.
